result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  
* Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 44 days time served.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1.5 years initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
* Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.

*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

records.addlTxt: Bail Assignment from Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Defendant Charles E Jackson in custody.  James C Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2.5  years with credit for 44 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2.5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1.5 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen who appeared via telephone.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Michael Sutor.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Sentencing  on May 11, 2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Case scheduled for sentencing on May 11, 2016 at 1:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 & 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
